oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Concern "The Trouble at Highlander" issue
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Special issue of Concern titled "The Trouble at Highlander". Contains interview with Myles Horton, a story related to litigation by Alice Cobb, and a report on an interview with A. F. Sloan. Also includes reaction letter statements by Eleanor Roosevelt, Roger L. Shinn, John O'Grady, and Reinhold Niebuhr. Cover art by Herschel Pollard shows a scene at the grounds of the school.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Cobb, Alice; Horton, Myles, 1905-1990; Niebuhr, Reinhold, 1892-1971; Roosevelt, Eleanor, 1884-1962
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Civil rights; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Governmental investigations; Education; Beer; Race relations; School integration; Segregation in education; Segregation--Law and legislation; Labor unions; Citizenship--Study and teaching; Literacy tests (Election law); Voting; Communism; Subversive activities; Pre-trial procedure; Witnesses; Race relations in school management; Public nuisance; United States. Congress. House. Committee on Un-American Activities; Legislative hearings
